div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1644 Asyut (anc. Lycopolis) environs, 300 km. S of Cairo, 1968 or 1969 Burial: c. 475 B.C. (Price) Contents: 681+ AR. Many fragmented and chiseled; found with 3+ AR ingots Metapontum: 2 st. Caulonia: 1 st. Croton: 1 st. Rhegium: 1 dr. Himera: 3 dr. Zankle: 2 dr. Samian Zankle: 12 tetradr. (5 undated, 1 dated Α, 1 dated Β, 5 dated Δ) Acanthus: 37 tetradr. 1 tetrob. Aegae: 3 st. Aeneia: 1 tetradr. Mende: 15 tetradr. Olynthus: 1 tetradr. Potidaea: 6 tetradr. Scione: 2 tetradr. Sermyle: 2 tetradr. Stagira: 1 tetradr. Terone: 11 tetradr. Derrones: 10 octadr. 1 dodecadr.? 1 triob.? Ichnae: 4 octadr. Orrescii: 32 st. Alexander I: 1 octadr. Maced. unc.: 16 Abdera: 10 octadr. 2 tetradr. Dicaea Thraciae: 3 tetradr. Thracian Chersonese?: 1 triob.? Thasos: 27 st. Peparethus: 1 tetradr. Corcyra: 4 st. Leucas: 1 st. Delphi: 7 tridr. Tanagra: 3 half st. Carystus: 3 tetradr. Chalcis: 1 tetradr. Eretria: 2 tetradr. 3 fr. Athens: 2 Wappenm. (1 tetradr., 1 dr.) 127 tetradr. (unwreathed) 1 dr. 1 hemidr. Aegina: 74 st. (sea turtles, incl. Holloway's class 4) Corinth: 29 st. Melos: 2 st. Melos?: 1 st. Naxos: 3 st. Paros: 6 dr. Tenos?: 1 st. Abydus: 1 diob.? Lampsacus: 1 diob.? Parium: 1 dr. Lesbos: 1 triob. Clazomenae: 1 didr. Miletus: 5 ob.? Teos: 5 st. 1 dr. Chios: 8 st. Samos: 15 tetradr. Cnidus: 2 dr. 1 ob.? Carpathus: 4 st. Cos: 1 tetradr. Camirus: 5 tetradr. Ialysus: 4 tetradr. Lindus: 5 tetradr. Caria unc.: 16 st. Phaselis: 9 st. Lycian dynasts: 22 st. 1 tetrob. Idalium: 1 st. Lapethus: 5 st. Paphus ?: 2 st. 1 third st. Salamis: 16 st. Cyprus unc.: 10 st. Persia: 10 sigloi Cyrene: 35 tetradr. Barce: 4 tetradr. Unc.: 3 Illeg.: 3 Disposition: c. 35 pieces in public and private colls. Record of pieces listed above on file in London and New York To be published by M. Price and N. Waggoner
